text: Treat yourself like someone who matters.
author: Anonymous

text: Feed your body, mind, and soul daily.
author: Anonymous

text: Self-love is the soil; growth is the garden.
author: Anonymous

text: Talk to yourself, not just about yourself.
author: Anonymous

text: Make tenderness a habit.
author: Anonymous

text: Choose clothes that feel like yes.
author: Anonymous

text: Water what you want to bloom in you.
author: Anonymous

text: Celebrate tiny acts of care.
author: Anonymous

text: Forgive yourself for learning slowly.
author: Anonymous

text: Be your own safe place.
author: Anonymous

text: Protect your energy like treasure.
author: Anonymous

text: Write yourself kind notes.
author: Anonymous

text: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
author: Buddha (trad.)

text: The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and love.
author: William Wordsworth

text: Let your inner voice practice gentleness.
author: Anonymous

text: Make rest part of the ritual, not the reward.
author: Anonymous

text: Speak to yourself like a teammate, not a taskmaster.
author: Anonymous

text: Nourish before you push.
author: Anonymous

text: Choose habits that feel like respect.
author: Anonymous

text: Replace judgment with curiosity.
author: Anonymous

text: Let small kindnesses accumulate into culture.
author: Anonymous

text: Your softness is not a weakness; it's a strategy for healing.
author: Anonymous

text: Celebrate the version of you that kept going.
author: Anonymous

text: Love the learner in you, not just the achiever.
author: Anonymous

text: Make room for your own applause.
author: Anonymous
